_components._string:
The Global Initiative for
Honey bee Health
_components._N$string:
The Global Initiative for
Honey bee Health

_components._string:
Honey bees are vital for the pollination of crops, but recently they’ve been disappearing in massive numbers worldwide. This phenomenon is potentially a critical problem; if crops aren’t pollinated, it could trigger a food crisis. The Global Initiative for Honeybee Health (GIHH) now uses Hitachi Chemical’s ultra-small RFID (Radio Frequency Identification) tags to monitor honey bee behaviour and find answers.

By recording and analysing data, including the time honey bees leave and return to their beehive, the GIHH is attempting to identify causal relationships with the surrounding environment, including temperature, humidity, and the amount of chemical substances present.

By recording and analysing data, including the time honey bees leave and return to their beehive, the GIHH is attempting to identify causal relationships with the surrounding environment, including temperature, humidity, and the amount of chemical substances present.

_components._string: Help solve the mystery of disappearing honey bees around the world by flying the bee with its RFID attached through the hives where sensors will collect crucial data for analysis.
_components._N$string: Help solve the mystery of disappearing honey bees around the world by flying the bee with its RFID attached through the hives where sensors will collect crucial data for analysis.

_components._string: Tap to fly the bee through the game
_components._N$string: Tap to fly the bee through the game

_components._string: Keeping flying for as long as possible to send data back from the RFID (Radio Frequency Identification) tag.
_components._N$string: Keeping flying for as long as possible to send data back from the RFID (Radio Frequency Identification) tag.

_components._string: Parasites and diseases are a threat to pollinators. In some regions mite and virus species have severely compromised honey bee colonies.
_components._N$string: Parasites and diseases are a threat to pollinators. In some regions mite and virus species have severely compromised honey bee colonies.

_components._string: ​Pesticides often kill directly, but sub-lethal amounts can also be detrimental to bees by impeding their ability to navigate or forage.
_components._N$string: ​Pesticides often kill directly, but sub-lethal amounts can also be detrimental to bees by impeding their ability to navigate or forage.

_components._string: Pollinate as many flowers as you can and watch out for the threats!
_components._N$string: Pollinate as many flowers as you can and watch out for the threats!

_components._string: ​When non-native plants take over open fields, they crowd out the wildflowers needed by certain bee species for pollen, nectar, or larval food.
_components._N$string: ​When non-native plants take over open fields, they crowd out the wildflowers needed by certain bee species for pollen, nectar, or larval food.

_components._string: ​Pollinators can be affected when large, intact tracts of habitat are broken up by road construction, development, or agriculture.
_components._N$string: ​Pollinators can be affected when large, intact tracts of habitat are broken up by road construction, development, or agriculture.
